Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week

ChatGPT Agent Is Wild‚Ä¶
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 21, 2025
Explore the groundbreaking features of the ChatGPT Agent, showcasing its wild capabilities through engaging demos and benchmarks. This presentation highlights risks inherent in advanced AI tools while providing a comprehensive overview of performance metrics.
B.)
How Not to Read a Headline on AI (ft. New Olympiad Gold, GPT-5 ‚Ä¶)

The implications for the job market and the interaction between OpenAI and Google are explored, questioning whether fears around job security in white-collar sectors are warranted.
C.)
ChatGPT Agent Full Breakdown & More AI Use Cases
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | July 18, 2025

Explore the latest AI innovations, including Grok Companions, through live testing and concise updates that encapsulate the fast-evolving landscape of artificial intelligence.
D.)
Anthropic Quietly Imposes Stricter Usage Limits For Claude Code, Impacting Heavy And Max Plan Users

Since Monday morning, Claude Code users have been hit with unexpectedly restrictive usage limits. The problems, many of which have been aired on Claude Code‚Äôs GitHub page, seem to be concentrated among heavy users of the service, many of whom are on the $200-a-month Max plan.
E.)
How They Made These Memes Go Viral
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | July 17, 2025
Gain valuable insights into maximizing the potential of Veo3 while exploring effective strategies for meme creation. The session takes a deep dive into pushing the tool beyond its limits and offers alternative solutions when faced with challenges in the creative process.

5.)
I Built a Mobile AI App (And You Can Too)
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | July 28, 2025
Discover how to create and publish mobile applications with AI features using Bubble. This tutorial explores the transformation of a custom GPT into a fully functional mobile app, showcasing the ease and efficiency of building with Bubble.
6.)
They Finally Dropped an AI Architecture That Could Replace Human Thought
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | July 28, 2025
A new AI architecture has emerged, boasting capabilities that could rival human cognition. This innovative system not only simulates cognitive processes but also raises profound questions about the future of human intelligence and the ethics of machine autonomy.
7.)
VEO-3 Has A Secret Super Power!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | July 28, 2025
Explore the innovative technique of visual prompting with VEO-3, where users can scribble directly on images to direct animations. The video also highlights Runway‚Äôs new Aleph model, featuring advanced capabilities such as seamless object removal and style transfer, capturing the potential for enhancing both AI-generated and everyday video content.
8.)
OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT Agent Successfully Bypasses ‚ÄúI Am Not A Robot‚Äù Verification Test
| ArsTechnica.com | July 28, 2025
Maybe they should change the button to say, ‚ÄúI am a robot‚Äù? On Friday, OpenAI‚Äôs new ChatGPT Agent, which can perform multistep tasks for users, proved it can pass through one of the Internet‚Äôs most common security checkpoints by clicking Cloudflare‚Äôs anti-bot verification ‚Äî the same checkbox that‚Äôs supposed to keep automated programs like itself at bay.
9.)
Anthropic Imposes Weekly Claude Rate Limits, Sparking Backlash From Developers On Social Media
| VentureBeat.com | July 28, 2025
Anthropic announced today it would introduce weekly rate limits for Claude subscribers, claiming that some users have been running Claude 24/7, with the majority of usage centered around its Claude Code product.
10.)
Alibaba Unveils First AI-Powered Smart Glasses, Expanding Push Into Wearable Technology
| SCMP.com | July 28, 2025
The Quark glasses underscore the tech giant‚Äôs significant AI investments, which encompass both software and hardware products.
11.)
Microsoft Introduces Copilot Mode In Edge Browser, Offering A New AI-Powered Web Browsing Experience
| Blogs.windows.com | July 28, 2025
For decades, the way we‚Äôve used browsers has remained linear: open a tab (or 20), search for something, read a page, repeat. It‚Äôs a model that‚Äôs worked well, but it hasn‚Äôt fundamentally changed. Until now. As AI begins to reshape nearly every facet of digital life, we‚Äôre witnessing a turning point in how we interact with the web. Now, it‚Äôs worth asking: is your browser working for you as much as it should?
12.)
Microsoft Edge Adds Copilot Mode, Turning Browser Into AI-Powered Assistant For Analyzing Tabs And More
| TheVerge.com | July 28, 2025
Copilot Mode can search across all your open tabs, handle restaurant bookings, and more.
13.)
Tesla Signs $16.5B Deal With Samsung To Produce Next-Generation AI Chips
| TechCrunch.com | July 28, 2025
Tesla has signed a $16.5 billion deal to get its next-generation chips from Samsung.
14.)
SimilarWeb Unveils GenAI Intelligence Toolkit To Track Brand Visibility And AI-Driven Traffic
| MarTechSeries.com | July 28, 2025
New offering delivers a full-funnel view of brand performance ‚Äî measuring where your brand is seen and how much traffic it receives, versus competitors, from platforms like ChatGPT.
July 27, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
15.)
Almost Timely News: The Next Generation of AI Agents
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | July 27, 2025
Delve into the transformative landscape of AI agents, contrasting tools like OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT Agent, Google‚Äôs Opal, and Claude Code‚Äôs sub-agents. Learn to identify repetitive tasks suitable for automation and observe a step-by-step guide on creating a custom agent that automates complex content processes without coding expertise.
16.)
Unitree Launches $5,900 R1 Humanoid Robot With Agile Movement And Developer-Friendly Features
| DigitalTrends.com | July 27, 2025
Unitree Robotics has launched the R1, a remarkable humanoid robot capable of walking, running, dancing, cartwheeling, and even kung-fu kicks. It can also respond to voice commands and hold basic spoken conversations using integrated, AI-powered speech recognition, and process visual inputs via its built-in cameras.
July 26, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
17.)
AI News: GPT-5 Launch Date, Face Stealing Apps & Baby Grok
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | July 26, 2025
Key advancements in artificial intelligence are highlighted, showcasing Google‚Äôs innovative tools like Opal and new features in Google Photos. Additionally, the upcoming launch of OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-5 and notable AI applications from various companies are discussed, marking significant progress in the field.
18.)
Tencent Hunyuan Unveils Open-Source Hunyuan3D World Model For Interactive 3D World Generation
| X.com | July 26, 2025
We‚Äôre thrilled to release & open-source Hunyuan3D World Model 1.0! This model enables you to generate immersive, explorable, and interactive 3D worlds from just a sentence or an image.
July 25, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
19.)
5 AI App In 30 Minutes (ChatGPT + Lovable Tutorial)
| Tina Huang | YouTube.com | July 25, 2025
Tina provides a comprehensive walkthrough of five innovative AI applications you can start building today, perfect for anyone seeking fresh project ideas. Utilizing the platform Lovable, viewers can learn how to create functional apps while taking advantage of a limited-time discount.
20.)
OpenAI Teases GPT-5 as America Goes Full ‚ÄòAI Action‚Äô Mode
| AI For Humans | YouTube.com | July 25, 2025
Sam Altman unveils exciting insights into GPT-5 as the White House reveals its comprehensive AI Action Plan. The discussion highlights breakthroughs in AI coding, major achievements at the International Math Olympiad, and the use of AI in entertainment by Netflix and Disney.
21.)
The New King of AI Coding & More AI Use Cases
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | July 25, 2025
Qwen-3 coder has emerged as a powerful AI coding tool, surpassing competitors like Claude Code and Gemini CLI. The video explores various AI applications, including Hume‚Äôs new EVI 3 model with personality cloning, the MirageLSD demo, and insights on Grok 4 and ChatGPT Agent use cases.
22.)
What ChatGPT Agent Can Really Do
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | July 25, 2025
Discover the remarkable applications of ChatGPT Agent in digital marketing, highlighting its potential against traditional AI automation. Explore effective strategies, usage scenarios, and essential limitations to maximize its capabilities in your marketing efforts.
23.)
Runway Unveils Runway Aleph, Advancing AI-Powered Creative Tools And Research
| RunwayML.com | July 25, 2025
Runway Aleph is a state-of-the-art in-context video model, setting a new frontier for multi-task visual generation, with the ability to perform a wide range of edits on an input video such as adding, removing, and transforming objects, generating any angle of a scene, and modifying style and lighting, among many other tasks.
24.)
Podcast: Watch Us Test ChatGPT Agent Live For The First Time
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 25, 2025
In this engaging podcast episode, the hosts test OpenAI‚Äôs new ChatGPT Agent, revealing its capabilities and the implications for how we interact with technology. The hosts share live reactions as they explore various features and perform complex tasks, emphasizing the transformative potential of this AI tool.
25.)
Could AI Therapy Actually Work??
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 25, 2025
The emergence of AI in the realm of therapy, particularly a new AI tool called Ash, offers a potential solution to the growing mental health crisis, with a stark difference in approach compared to traditional AI models like ChatGPT. Ash has been designed specifically for therapy, utilizing advanced techniques and a substantial funding boost, and aims to provide a more constructive engagement by challenging users rather than merely validating their feelings.
26.)
Cursor Launches Bugbot Out Of Beta To Automate Pull Request Reviews In Its AI Code Editor
| Cursor.com | July 25, 2025
We‚Äôre excited to release Bugbot, our code review agent that automatically analyzes your changes to find logic bugs, edge cases, and security issues before they make it into production.
27.)
Microsoft Tests Copilot 3D Feature To Generate 3D Models From User-Uploaded Images
| TestingCatalog.com | July 25, 2025
What we know so far: Copilot 3D is an upcoming experiment where users will be able to generate 3D objects from any image. Currently, it appears in active development.
28.)
Microsoft Launches Copilot Appearance As AI CEO Hints At Personalized, Evolving Copilot Experiences
| TheVerge.com | July 25, 2025
Microsoft has a new Copilot Appearance virtual character that responds with real-time expressions.
29.)
Meshy Unveils Meshy 5 Preview With Smarter AI, Cleaner 3D Models, And Expanded Animation Features
| TechBullion.com | July 25, 2025
Meshy.ai, the world‚Äôs leading AI-powered 3D content generation platform, has launched the Meshy 5 Preview, offering early access to the next generation of AI 3D model generator. Built on the strong foundation of Meshy 4, this preview version introduces smarter generation tools, enhanced image alignment, sharper geometry, and over 500 new animations ‚Äî empowering creators to build faster, cleaner, and more creatively than ever before.
July 24, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
30.)
China Went Hard‚Ä¶
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 24, 2025
Explore the innovative developments in AI technology as Matthew Berman breaks down the latest advancements and their implications for the future. Engage with practical demos and insights that highlight the growing influence of AI in various sectors.
31.)
iOS 26 Hands-On: Liquid Glass!
| Marques Brownlee | YouTube.com | July 24, 2025
Innovative features like Liquid Glass and a revamped Camera App are highlighted in the latest iOS update, showcasing advancements that promise to enhance user experience. Key functionalities, including seamless CarPlay integration and an intuitive searching feature, mark significant improvements designed for everyday convenience.
32.)
Most Powerful Prompts for ChatGPT Right Now
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | July 24, 2025
Effective strategies for harnessing the power of ChatGPT are outlined, offering insights that enhance productivity, support learning, and promote mental wellness. Key prompts serve to simplify daily tasks and improve skills, ultimately leading to a transformative user experience.
33.)
VEO-3‚Äôs Wild Debate & Kling‚Äôs NEW Feature Will SHOCK You!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | July 24, 2025
Unpack the intense discussion surrounding text versus JSON prompting strategies for Veo-3, while gaining valuable insights and tips for enhancing your creative output. Additionally, explore Kling‚Äôs innovative Kling Lab workflow and get the latest updates from Midjourney about their video generation and API advancements.
34.)
We Go Hands-On With OpenAI‚Äôs New ChatGPT Agent LIVE
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | July 24, 2025
Corey Noles and Grant Harvey explore the capabilities of OpenAI‚Äôs latest innovation, the ChatGPT Agent, through live demonstrations. From generating competitive intelligence reports to crafting financial dashboards, they assess whether this AI tool signals the end of mundane tasks and represents a pivotal moment in the evolution of artificial intelligence.
35.)
The US AI Action Plan, Explained
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 24, 2025
The article outlines the newly released AI Action Plan by the U.S. government, highlighting its aim to position America as a leader in AI development. It discusses three main pillars focused on innovation, infrastructure, and international diplomacy, emphasizing the need for extensive energy infrastructure to support AI advancements.
36.)
Cursor‚Äôs New Bugbot Is Designed To Save Vibe Coders From Themselves
| Wired.com | July 24, 2025
Anysphere announces the launch of Bugbot, an AI tool aimed at enhancing error detection in code for developers using its Cursor platform, particularly in light of increased coding speeds due to AI. Bugbot integrates with Github to automatically flag errors, assisting both human and AI coding agents.
37.)
OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT Agent Now Available To All Plus, Pro, And Team Users
| X.com | July 24, 2025
ChatGPT agent is now fully rolled out to all Plus, Pro, and Team users. Sorry about the delay!
38.)
Google Launches Opal Tool To Build AI Mini-Apps With Natural Language In Google Labs
| Developers.googleblog.com | July 24, 2025
It‚Äôs never been easier to harness the power of AI models, prompts, and tools into working AI applications. We‚Äôre excited to announce Opal, a new experimental tool from Google Labs that lets you build and share powerful AI mini apps that chain together prompts, models, and tools ‚Äî all using simple natural language and visual editing. Opal is a great tool to accelerate prototyping AI ideas and workflows, demonstrate a proof of concept with a functional app, build custom AI apps to boost your productivity at work, and more. We‚Äôre launching it today and are so excited to see what you build.
39.)
OpenTable Launches AI-Powered Concierge Assistant To Enhance Diner Booking And Support Experience
| Pymnts.com | July 24, 2025
Restaurant booking company OpenTable has introduced a new artificial intelligence (AI) assistant to make it easier for diners to get answers to common questions and help restaurants convert queries into bookings.
40.)
Google Launches Web Guide, An AI-Powered Experimental Search Results Page In Search Labs
| Blog.google | July 24, 2025
We‚Äôre launching Web Guide, a Search Labs experiment that uses AI to intelligently organize the search results page, making it easier to find information and web pages.
41.)
OpenAI Unveils ChatGPT Personality Modes, Study Together, And Teases Sora 2 And GPT-5 Before Devday
| DigitalInformationWorld.com | July 24, 2025
OpenAI is rolling out a wave of new features and platform updates to ChatGPT as part of a broader effort to improve user interaction, expand educational use cases, and lay the groundwork for the next phase in AI model development. These changes are being released gradually and are expected to shape both how users experience the chatbot and how developers engage with OpenAI‚Äôs upcoming tools.
42.)
Figma Launches AI App Building Tool For All Users, Full Seat Access Required For Full Functionality
| TheVerge.com | July 24, 2025
Figma Make is out of beta and no longer reserved just for Figma‚Äôs full-access subscribers.
43.)
OpenAI Set To Launch GPT-5 AI Model In Early August
| TheVerge.com | July 24, 2025
Earlier this year, I heard that Microsoft engineers were preparing server capacity for OpenAI‚Äôs next-generation GPT-5 model, arriving as soon as late May. After some additional testing and delays, sources familiar with OpenAI‚Äôs plans tell me that GPT-5 is now expected to launch as early as next month.
44.)
Meta Innovates With Weather-Proof Tents For Faster AI Data Center Deployment
| X.com | July 24, 2025
We‚Äôre rapidly expanding our AI infrastructure and have adopted a novel approach of building weather-proof tents to house GPU clusters. This enables us to get new data centers online in months instead of years.
45.)
Tesla‚Äôs Elon Musk Announces AI Revival Of Vine
| X.com | July 24, 2025
We‚Äôre bringing back Vine, but in AI form.
July 23, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
46.)
AI News: Sam Altman‚Äôs Predictions, Talent Wars Continue, Project Stargate, Thinking Machines
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 23, 2025
Expert insights reveal groundbreaking developments in AI, including Sam Altman‚Äôs foresight on trends and challenges within the industry. The ongoing talent wars showcase major companies poaching top experts, while Project Stargate unveils new hurdles in the realm of AI technology.
47.)
Which AI Models Are The Best Right Now?
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 23, 2025
A new analysis outlines the current top AI models, highlighting Gemini 2.5 Pro as the best for text and vision tasks. Insights also cover Grok 4‚Äôs performance and the potential implications of emerging AI technologies in various sectors, including banking and data centers.
48.)
Brave Browser Blocks Microsoft Recall Feature To Protect User Privacy From Screenshot Tracking
| TheRegister.com | July 23, 2025
In an effort to protect user privacy, Brave browser 1.81 will prevent Microsoft Recall from screenshotting it by default.
49.)
White House Unveils Comprehensive AI Policy Recommendations, SiliconAngle Reports
| SiliconAngle.com | July 23, 2025
The White House today released a policy paper with more than 90 recommendations on how the federal government should approach artificial intelligence.
50.)
Nvidia Avoided Breakup After CEO Jensen Huang Convinced Trump Of Company‚Äôs Importance In AI Chips
| TheVerge.com | July 23, 2025
Now he‚Äôs praising Jensen Huang, who successfully convinced Trump to let him sell chips in China.
51.)
Deepmind Unveils Aeneas AI Model To Help Historians Interpret And Restore Ancient Inscriptions
| Deepmind.google | July 23, 2025
Introducing the first model for contextualizing ancient inscriptions, designed to help historians better interpret, attribute and restore fragmentary texts.
52.)
Github Launches Spark In Public Preview For Copilot Pro+ Subscribers To Accelerate App Development
| Github.blog | July 23, 2025
Stuck between idea and implementation? Spending weeks on mock ups or docs that never ship? GitHub Spark takes you from idea to deployed app in minutes. Build and ship full-stack intelligent apps using natural language with access to the full power of the GitHub platform ‚Äî no setup, no configuration, and no headaches.
53.)
Sam Altman Sits Down With Theo Von On This Past Weekend
| Youtube.com | July 23, 2025
Theo joins Sam at the OpenAI office in San Francisco to talk about the pros and cons of developing AI so rapidly, how these new technologies will change our idea of ‚Äúwork‚Äù forever, and the ethical debate around the merging of man and machine.
54.)
Higgsfield AI Launches Tool To Recreate And Personalize Any Web Image With Soul Id
| X.com | July 23, 2025
Introducing Higgsfield Steal. Recreate ANY picture from anywhere on the web. Personalize it with Soul ID. When we say anything, we MEAN anything.
55.)
OpenAI Announces Third Annual Devday Event For October 6, 2025 In San Francisco
| OpenAI.com | July 23, 2025
We‚Äôre hosting our third annual OpenAI DevDay on October 6, 2025 at Fort Mason in San Francisco.
56.)
Google Photos Adds New Tools To Turn Photos Into Videos And Remix Images With Creation Features
| Blog.google | July 23, 2025
Google Photos began as a place to store your memories and turned into much more. It‚Äôs a way to explore your images and reminisce, share them easily and even get creative. Today we‚Äôre introducing a few new creative tools that will help you bring your memories to life. With new features for making videos from still photos, transforming pictures into illustrations and more, there‚Äôs a lot to try ‚Äî and then share them with friends and family. Here‚Äôs a look at what‚Äôs new.
57.)
Proton Launches Lumo AI Chatbot Focused On Confidential, Private Conversations For Users
| Proton.me | July 23, 2025
Artificial intelligence has the power to tackle humanity‚Äôs challenges, big and small, from scheduling meetings to modeling molecules. But to truly transform how we live and work for the better, we need an AI assistant built responsibly ‚Äî putting people and privacy first.
58.)
Research: Deepmind‚Äôs AI Uncovers Ancient Secrets
| Nature.com | July 23, 2025
Human history is born in writing. Inscriptions are among the earliest written forms, and offer direct insights into the thought, language and history of ancient civilizations. Historians capture these insights by identifying parallels‚Äîinscriptions with shared phrasing, function or cultural setting‚Äîto enable the contextualization of texts within broader historical frameworks, and perform key tasks such as restoration and geographical or chronological attribution1. However, current digital methods are restricted to literal matches and narrow historical scopes. Here we introduce Aeneas, a generative neural network for contextualizing ancient texts. Aeneas retrieves textual and contextual parallels, leverages visual inputs, handles arbitrary-length text restoration, and advances the state of the art in key tasks.
59.)
Guitar Center Launches In-Store AI Assistant To Transform Shops Into Tech-Powered Music Hubs
| RetailTouchPoints.com | July 23, 2025
Guitar Center has launched an AI-powered shopping assistant, available not online, but rather on the store floor. The mobile-based Rig Advisor is designed to give musicians an easy way to navigate store options and make more confident decisions, whether they‚Äôre browsing solo or working with a store expert.
60.)
Github Launches Free Inference API To Boost AI Accessibility For Open Source Projects
| Github.blog | July 23, 2025
AI features can make an open source project shine. At least, until setup asks for a paid inference API key. Requiring contributors or even casual users to bring their own large language model (LLM) key stops adoption in its tracks.
61.)
Anthropic Teams With University Of Chicago For Research On AI‚Äôs Impact On Labor And The Economy
| Anthropic.com | July 23, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre announcing a partnership with the University of Chicago‚Äôs Becker Friedman Institute for Economics (BFI) to study AI‚Äôs impact on labor markets and the economy. As part of this, we will equip BFI faculty economists with Claude for Enterprise access, provide training sessions on applying AI in economic research, and offer virtual workshops on our research to measure AI‚Äôs economic impacts. This partnership is an extension of our Economic Index initiative, which is dedicated to tracking and understanding AI‚Äôs effects on the economy over time.
62.)
Google Unveils Gemini 2.5 Conversational Image Segmentation For Intuitive Visual Data Interaction
| Developers.googleblog.com | July 23, 2025
The way AI visually understands images has evolved tremendously. Initially, AI could tell us ‚Äúwhere‚Äù an object was using bounding boxes. Then, segmentation models arrived, precisely outlining an object‚Äôs shape. More recently, open-vocabulary models emerged, allowing us to segment objects using less common labels like ‚Äúblue ski boot‚Äù or ‚Äúxylophone‚Äù without needing a predefined list of categories.
63.)
Leonardo.ai Launches Veo 3 Fast: Quicker Video Generation With Sound
| X.com | July 23, 2025
Veo 3 Fast is now live on Leonardo. Generate 8s videos with sound up to 3x faster than regular Veo 3. Supports generations up to 1080p.
July 22, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
64.)
Inside Google‚Äôs AI Lab: Drug Discovery, World AI Model & AlphaEvolve
| The Next Wave | YouTube.com | July 22, 2025
Matt Wolfe engages with DeepMind CEO Sir Demis Hassabis to explore groundbreaking advancements in AI, particularly in drug discovery and robotics. The conversation delves into the complexities of AI ethics and the societal implications of deploying such powerful technologies.
65.)
OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT Agent Is Haunting My Browser
| Wired.com | July 22, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT Agent allows users to automate web tasks, navigating challenges that often reveal its limitations. This exploration raises concerns about the potential impact of AI on traditional browsing experiences and digital advertising, hinting at a future where humans may become less involved in online interactions.
66.)
Analyzing Today‚ÄôS AI Based On Usage, Intelligence, And Revenue‚Ä¶
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 22, 2025
The article reviews the current landscape of AI, highlighting significant statistics on usage, revenue, and emerging issues such as AI job cuts and the rising prevalence of AI companions among teens. Key points include OpenAI‚Äôs rapid growth and the competitive energy demands for the U.S. AI sector.
67.)
WP Engine Launches AI Toolkit To Add Smart Search And AI Features To WordPress Sites
| Searchenginejournal.com | July 22, 2025
WP Engine‚Äôs AI Toolkit easily integrates advanced AI features to WordPress sites, including smart search and personalized content.
68.)
Apple Restores Notification Summaries For News Apps In iOS 26 Beta 4 And Other OS Updates
| MacRumors.com | July 22, 2025
With the fourth betas of iOS 26, iPadOS 26, macOS 26, visionOS 26, and watchOS 26, Apple has re-enabled Apple Intelligence Notification Summaries for apps in the News and Entertainment categories.
69.)
Amazon Acquires Bee AI Wearable, Expanding Its Push Into Always-Listening AI Devices
| TheVerge.com | July 22, 2025
Bee is a Fitbit-like device that transcribes your conversations and serves up daily summaries.
70.)
